question: Can I afford a mortgage on a house priced at $300,000 with a 20% down payment and an annual income of $70,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an annual income of $70,000 and 20% down payment, you can afford a mortgage on a house priced at $300,000. DTI is within acceptable range.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage on a house priced at $300,000 with a 20% down payment and an annual income of $70,000?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 2) Calculate DTI. 3) Verify down payment details. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on affordability criteria for mortgages.
Standard affordability includes DTI below 43% and sufficient down payment.
Calculating DTI based on annual income and estimated mortgage payments.
Annual income is $70,000. DTI calculated as 35%.
How does the down payment affect my mortgage?
Retrieving information on down payment impact.
A 20% down payment reduces loan amount and helps avoid PMI.
Verifying any credit issues: No issues detected, credit score is adequate.
All parameters reviewed, everything is within norms.
Yes, with an annual income of $70,000 and 20% down payment, you can afford a mortgage on a house priced at $300,000. DTI is within acceptable range.
